iterations.description: Adding window controls (min/max/close) to full screen mode improves usability, aligning with common full-screen behaviors in other applications (e.g., browsers, RDP).

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
There are 2 options for implementing this:
- We stop hiding the window title bar, which is what shows those buttons. This provides the buttons for free, but adds a few cm of dead space at the top.
- We reimplement the minimize, maximize, and close buttons as a separate toolbar which can be docked and moved like the external tools toolbar. Do we show this toolbar all the time, or just when in *Full Screen* mode?

comments.author: PetbkA
comments.snippet:
If I'm not mistaken, option 1 equals to removing _Full Screen_ mode at all.

If option 2 will make window like the one in Chrome then it's pretty fine

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Adding window controls (min/max/close) to full screen mode improves usability, aligning with common full-screen behaviors in other applications (e.g., browsers, RDP).
Approach: Create a floating or auto-hiding panel/toolbar containing minimize, maximize/restore, and close buttons. Show this panel when the mouse hovers near the top of the screen while in full screen mode (handled in FullscreenHandler). Connect the button events to frmMain's window state and close methods.
